greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference sequence of A325417.
comment: See A325417 for a guide to related sequences. Conjecture: all the differences are in {1,2,3,4}; a count of differences d(n) = a(n)-a(n-1) for n=2..10000 follows: 4755 occurrences of d(n) = 1; 4332 of 2; 744 of 3; and 169 of 4.
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: A325417 is given by A(n) = least number not 2*A(m) or 3*A(m)+1 for any m < n, so that A = (1,3,5,7,8,9,11, ...), with differences (2,2,2,1,1,2,...).
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 03 2019
